conclusion: Determine if the difference in displacement between objects A and B is continuously increasing.
Displacement is found by calculating the area under the velocity-time graph.
Area under curve A represents displacement of Object A; area under curve B represents displacement of Object B.
Shaded region in the image represents the difference in area under the curves of A and B.
Shaded region is where velocity of A is greater than velocity of B.
Shaded region starts from t = 0 and ends at t = t1.
Width of shaded region increases from left to right along the time axis.
Width of shaded region indicates difference in velocities between A and B at any time t.
Increasing width of shaded region implies increasing difference in velocities and rate of change of displacement.
Difference in displacements must be continuously increasing over the interval 0 to t1.
Final answer: Yes, the difference in displacement is necessarily continuously increasing.
